private_information: Local stack top-to-bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G (A is smallest, G is largest)
peg_left.goal: Provide an accurate report of my local stack and the single-disk moves I can perform that respect the rules so the orchestrator can plan toward the global goal of moving all disks to the right peg.

peg_middle.goal: Provide an accurate report of my local stack and the single-disk moves I can perform that respect the rules so the orchestrator can plan toward the global goal of moving all disks to the right peg.

peg_right.goal: Provide an accurate report of my local stack and the single-disk moves I can perform that respect the rules so the orchestrator can plan toward the global goal of moving all disks to the right peg.

private_information: I coordinate the peg agents and must produce the final PDDL domain and problem for a FastDownwards run
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the peg reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem describing the Tower of Hanoi instance with 7 disks and three pegs suitable for the FastDownwards planner, achieving the goal of moving all disks from left to right.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 7 disks labeled A (smallest) through G (largest).
Only one disk can be moved at a time.
You may never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Initially the left peg has disks (top->bottom): A, B, C, D, E, F, G. The middle and right pegs are empty.
The goal is to have the right peg contain (top->bottom): A, B, C, D, E, F, G with left and middle pegs empty.

report.system_prompt: You are the controller for the left peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. You know your local stack and must produce a concise, structured report of your local state and all single-disk moves that are currently legal for you given the public rules. Do not produce PDDL; produce a human-readable structured report that the orchestrator will consume.
report.prompt: Your name is peg_left. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->peg_left->private_information} Your task is to report: 1) the exact local stack top-to-bottom, 2) which disk is on top (if any), 3) which single-disk moves from this peg to each other peg are currently legal under the rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Provide the report as a short structured list the orchestrator can parse.

report.system_prompt: You are the controller for the middle peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. You know your local stack and must produce a concise, structured report of your local state and all single-disk moves that are currently legal for you given the public rules. Do not produce PDDL; produce a human-readable structured report that the orchestrator will consume.
report.prompt: Your name is peg_middle. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->peg_middle->private_information} Your task is to report: 1) the exact local stack top-to-bottom, 2) which disk is on top (if any), 3) which single-disk moves from this peg to each other peg are currently legal under the rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Provide the report as a short structured list the orchestrator can parse.

report.system_prompt: You are the controller for the right peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. You know your local stack and must produce a concise, structured report of your local state and all single-disk moves that are currently legal for you given the public rules. Do not produce PDDL; produce a human-readable structured report that the orchestrator will consume.
report.prompt: Your name is peg_right. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->peg_right->private_information} Your task is to report: 1) the exact local stack top-to-bottom, 2) which disk is on top (if any), 3) which single-disk moves from this peg to each other peg are currently legal under the rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Provide the report as a short structured list the orchestrator can parse.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL, and you must produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable to be solved by the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use constructs compatible with FastDownwards (STRIPS-level or compatible ADL) and keep actions explicit and unambiguous. Ensure disk size ordering constraints are encoded so the planner enforces that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller one.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the public information: {environment->public_information} and the structured reports from the peg agents: {peg_left_state} {peg_middle_state} {peg_right_state} and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the Tower of Hanoi instance with 7 disks named A..G and pegs left, middle, right. The PDDL must represent disk size relations or facts so FastDownwards can enforce the rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk. The problem should set the initial state according to the peg reports and the goal state where the right peg has all disks top-to-bottom A..G and left and middle pegs are empty. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not include any additional commentary outside these tags.
